page.title: 17Saint Andrew's Church Dent.
page.content: This Norman Church was founded around 1080 most likely being in the care of monks in Covern Abbey,near Middleham.Since the church has been on this spot it has been in four Dioceses,York, Chester,Ripon and now Bradford.In 1417 the church was rebuilt and has been restored since then.The original Norman tower fell down in 1772;it was rebuilt in 1787 using the original stone.1828 saw the addition of the clock we see today. Piers of the original Norman church form part of the present church,the front pair being octagonal.Box pews from the 17th century can be found in the side aisles.1614 is the date found on the pulpit which was part of a Jacobean three decker pulpit.Dent Marble edged with Barrow limestone makes a most attractive chancel floor,which is full of fossils.
